items.name: Ext.data.field.Field
allowBlank
items.text:
Used for validating a {@link Ext.data.Model}. Defaults to true. An empty value here will cause
{@link Ext.data.Model}.{@link Ext.data.Model#method!isValid Ext.data.Model#isValid} to evaluate to false.

items.name: allowNull
items.text:
Use when converting received data into a {@link Ext.data.field.Integer},
{@link Ext.data.field.Number}, {@link Ext.data.field.Boolean}
or {@link Ext.data.field.String} type. If the value cannot be
parsed, `{@link null}` will be used if allowNull is true, otherwise a default value for that type will be used:

- for `int` and `float` - `0`.
- for `string` - `""`.
- for `bool` - `false`.

Note that when parsing of {@link Ext.data.field.Date} type fails, the value will
be `{@link null}` regardless of this setting.

items.name: calculate
data
items.text:
An object with all values for each field in the parent
model.  See {@link Ext.data.Model#method!getData Ext.data.Model#getData}.
value The value of the calculated field

items.name: convert
items.text:
If specified this config overrides the `{@link #method!convert #method-convert}` method. See
also `{@link #cfg!calculate #cfg-calculate}` for simple field calculations.

**Note:** The use of {@link #cfg!calculate #calculate} and convert are exclusive.  The calculate
method will override the convert method if both are configured.

items.name: critical
items.text:
A critical field is a field that must always be sent to the server even if it has
not changed. The most common example of such a field is the "id" of a record (see
`{@link Ext.data.Model#cfg!idProperty Ext.data.Model#idProperty}` but the `{@link Ext.data.Model#cfg!versionProperty Ext.data.Model#versionProperty}`
is similarly a `{@link #cfg!critical critical}` field.

items.name: defaultValue
items.text:
The default value used when the creating an instance from a raw data object,
and the property referenced by the `{@link Ext.data.field.Field#cfg!mapping Ext.data.field.Field#mapping}`
does not exist in that data object.

The value `{@link undefined}` prevents defaulting in a value.

items.name: depends
mapping
name
items.text:
The name by which the field is referenced within the Model. This is referenced by,
for example, the `dataIndex` property in column definition objects passed to
{@link Ext.grid.property.HeaderContainer}.

Note: In the simplest case, if no properties other than `{@link #cfg!name name}` are required, a
field definition may consist of just a String for the field name.

items.name: persist
items.text:
False to exclude this field from the {@link Ext.data.Model#property!modified Ext.data.Model#modified} fields in a
record. This will also exclude the field from being written using a
{@link Ext.data.writer.Writer}. This option is useful when fields are used to keep
state on the client but do not need to be persisted to the server.

Defaults to `false` for `{@link #property!calculated calculated}` fields and `true` otherwise.

items.name: reference
type
items.text:
The type which this field references. This is the value set by the string form of
`{@link #cfg!reference reference}`. If the referenced entity has an ownership relationship this field
should be omitted and `reference.parent` or `reference.child` should be specified
instead.

items.name: association
items.text:
The name of the association. By default, the name of the association is the
capitalized `inverse` plus "By" plus the capitalized `role`.

items.name: child
items.text:
Set this property instead of `reference.type` to indicate that the referenced entity
is an owned child of this entity. That is, the `{@link #cfg!reference reference}` entity should be deleted
when this entity is deleted.

items.name: parent
items.text:
Set this property instead of `reference.type` to indicate that the referenced entity
is the owning parent of this entity. That is, this entity should be deleted when the
`{@link #cfg!reference reference}` entity is deleted.

items.name: role
items.text:
The name of the role played by the referenced entity. By default, this is the field
name (minus its "Id" suffix if present).

items.name: inverse
items.text:
The name of the inverse role (of this entity with respect to the `{@link #cfg!reference reference}`
entity). By default, this is the {@link Ext.util.Inflector#method!pluralize Ext.util.Inflector#pluralize}
name of this entity, unless this `{@link #cfg!reference reference}` is `{@link #cfg!unique unique}`, in which case the default
name is the {@link Ext.util.Inflector#method!singularize Ext.util.Inflector#singularize} name of this entity.

This config may also be an object containing a role, getter, or setter.

items.name: sortType
unique
items.text:
`true` if the value of this field is unique amongst all instances. When used with a
`{@link #cfg!reference reference}` this describes a "one-to-one" relationship. It is almost always the case
that a `{@link #cfg!unique unique}` field cannot also be {@link #cfg!allowBlank #allowBlank}.

items.name: validators
items.text:
An array of {@link Ext.data.validator.Validator} for this field. These
`{@link #cfg!validators validators}` will only be passed a field value to validate.

items.name: addDeprecations
items.text:
This method applies a versioned, deprecation declaration to this class. This
is typically called by the `deprecated` config.

items.name: callParent
args
items.text:
The arguments, either an array or the `arguments` object
from the current method, for example: `this.callParent(arguments)`
Returns the result of calling the parent method

items.name: callSuper
args
items.text:
The arguments, either an array or the `arguments` object
from the current method, for example: `this.callSuper(arguments)`
Returns the result of calling the superclass method

items.name: collate
items.text:
Compares two values to retrieve their relative position in sort order, taking into account
any {@link #cfg!sortType #sortType}. Also see {@link #method!compare #compare}.

items.name: value1
items.text: The first value.

items.name: value2
items.text: The second value.

`-1` if `value1` is less than `value2`. `1` if `value1` is greater than `value2`.
`0` otherwise.

items.name: compare
items.text:
Compares two values to retrieve their relative position in sort order. Also see
{@link #method!collate #collate}.

items.name: value1
items.text: The first value.

items.name: value2
items.text: The second value.

`-1` if `value1` is less than `value2`. `1` if `value1` is greater than `value2`.
`0` otherwise.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates new Object.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to wrap.

items.name: convert
value
items.text:
The data value as read by the Reader, if undefined will use
the configured `{@link #cfg!defaultValue defaultValue}`.

items.name: record
items.text:
The data object containing the Model as read so far
by the Reader. Note that the Model may not be fully populated at this point as the
fields are read in the order that they are defined.
{@link Ext.data.Model#cfg!fields Ext.data.Model#cfg-fields} array.
The converted value for storage in the record.

items.name: destroy
items.text:
This method is called to cleanup an object and its resources. After calling
this method, the object should not be used any further.

items.name: getAllowBlank
items.text: Gets allowBlank for this field. See {@link #cfg!allowBlank #allowBlank}.
allowBlank

items.name: getAllowNull
items.text: Gets allowNull for this field. See {@link #cfg!allowNull #allowNull}.
allowNull

items.name: getConfig
items.text:
Returns a specified config property value. If the name parameter is not passed,
all current configuration options will be returned as key value pairs.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the config property to get.

items.name: peek
items.text: `true` to peek at the raw value without calling the getter.
The config property value.

items.name: getConvert
items.text: Gets converter for this field. See {@link #method!convert #method-convert}.
convert

items.name: getDefaultValue
items.text: Gets the defaultValue for this field. See {@link #cfg!defaultValue #defaultValue}.
defaultValue

items.name: getDepends
items.text: Gets the depends for this field. See {@link #cfg!depends #depends}.
depends

items.name: getInitialConfig
name
items.text: Name of the config option to return.

The full config object or a single config value
when `{@link #cfg!name name}` parameter specified.

items.name: getMapping
items.text: Get the mapping for this field. See {@link #cfg!mapping #mapping}.
mapping

items.name: getName
items.text: Gets the name for this field. See {@link #cfg!name #name}.
name

items.name: getPersist
items.text: Gets the persist for this field. See {@link #cfg!persist #persist}.
persist

items.name: getSortType
items.text: Gets the sortType for this field. See {@link #cfg!sortType #sortType}.
sortType

items.name: getType
items.text: Gets a string representation of the type of this field.
type

items.name: hasMapping
items.text: Checks if this field has a mapping applied.
`true` if this field has a mapping.

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: initConfig

items.text: this

items.name: isEqual
items.text:
Tests whether two values are equal based on this field type.
This uses the {@link #method!compare #compare} method to determine equality, so
this method should generally not be overridden.

items.name: value1
items.text: The first value.

items.name: value2
items.text: The second value.
`true` if the values are equal.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: link
items.text:
Adds a "destroyable" object to an internal list of objects that will be destroyed
when this instance is destroyed (via `{@link #method!destroy #destroy}`).
The `value` passed.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: serialize
items.text:
A function which converts the Model's value for this Field into a form which can be used by whatever {@link Ext.data.writer.Writer}
is being used to sync data with the server.

items.name: value
items.text: The Field's value - the value to be serialized.

items.name: record
items.text: The record being serialized.
The string that represents the Field's value.

items.name: setConfig
items.text: Sets a single/multiple configuration options.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the property to set, or a set of key value pairs to set.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to set for the name parameter.
this

items.name: statics
toLocaleString
items.text:
Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects
for locale-specific purposes.

`{@link Object}`'s `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}` returns the result of calling `{@link #method!toString toString}`.

This function is provided to give objects a generic `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}` method, even though not all
may use it. Currently, only `{@link Array}`, `{@link Number}`, and `{@link Date}` override `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}`.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: unlink
items.text:
Destroys a given set of `{@link #method!link #link}` objects. This is only needed if
the linked object is being destroyed before this instance.

items.name: names
items.text: The names of the linked objects to destroy.
this

items.name: validate
items.text: Validates the passed value for this field.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to validate.

items.name: separator
items.text:
This string is passed if the caller wants all validation
messages concatenated with this string between each. This can be handled as a
"falsy" value because concatenating with no separator is seldom desirable.

items.name: errors
items.text:
This parameter is passed if the caller
wants all validation results individually added to the collection.

`true` if the value is valid. A string may be returned if
the value is not valid, to indicate an error message. Any other non `true` value
indicates the value is not valid. This method is not implemented by default,
subclasses may override it to provide an implementation.

items.name: valueOf
items.text:
Returns the primitive value of the specified object.

JavaScript calls the `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to
invoke the `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an
object where a primitive value is expected.

By default, the `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method is inherited by every object descended from `{@link Object}`. Every built-
in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive
value, `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` returns the object itself, which is displayed as:

    [object Object]

You can use `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value.
When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead
of the default `{@link Object}` method.

You can create a function to be called in place of the default `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method. Your function must
take no arguments.

Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method for it.
The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method:

    myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText)

With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context
where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function
defined in the preceding code.

An object's `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as
follows:

    myNumber.valueOf()

Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the `{@link #method!toString toString}` method, which is different from
`{@link String}` objects converting to string primitives using `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}`. All objects have a string
conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or
function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: $configPrefixed
items.text:
The value `true` causes `config` values to be stored on instances using a
property name prefixed with an underscore ("_") character. A value of `false`
stores `config` values as properties using their exact name (no prefix).

items.name: $configStrict
items.text:
The value `true` instructs the `{@link #method!initConfig initConfig}` method to only honor values for
properties declared in the `config` block of a class. When `false`, properties
that are not declared in a `config` block will be placed on the instance.

items.name: calculated
items.text:
This property is `true` if this field has a `{@link #cfg!calculate #cfg-calculate}`
method or a `{@link #method!convert #method-convert}` method that operates on the entire
record as opposed to just the data value. This property is determined from the
`length` of the `{@link #method!convert #method-convert}` function which means this is
*not* calculated:

     convert: function (value) {
         return ...
     }

While this *is* calculated:

     convert: function (value, record) {
         return ...
     }

**NOTE:** It is recommended for such fields to use `{@link #cfg!calculate #cfg-calculate}`
or explicitly specify the fields used by `{@link #method!convert #method-convert}` using
`{@link #cfg!depends #cfg-depends}`.

items.name: constructor
defaultInvalidMessage
items.text: The default message to present for an invalid field.

items.name: definedBy
dependents
items.text:
This array tracks the fields that have indicated this field in their `{@link #cfg!depends depends}`
list. If no fields depend on this field, this will be `{@link null}`.

items.name: destroyed
items.text: This property is set to `true` after the `{@link #method!destroy destroy}` method is called.

items.name: evil
items.text:
This flag is set to true for fields that have `convert` methods which take the 2nd
argument (the record) and do not specify a `{@link #cfg!depends depends}` set. Good fields indicate the
fields on which they depend (if any).

items.name: factoryConfig
items.text:
If this property is specified by the target class of this mixin its properties are
used to configure the created `{@link Ext.Factory}`.

items.name: identifier
items.text:
This property is set to `true` if this is an {@link Ext.data.Model#cfg!idProperty Ext.data.Model#idProperty}
field.

items.name: isConfiguring
items.text: This property is set to `true` during the call to `{@link #method!initConfig initConfig}`.

items.name: isFirstInstance
items.text: This property is set to `true` if this instance is the first of its class.

items.name: isInstance
items.text:
This value is `true` and is used to identify plain objects from instances of
a defined class.

items.name: ordinal
items.text: The position of this field in the {@link Ext.data.Model} in which it was defined.

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: rank
items.text:
This is a 1-based value that describes the dependency order of this field. This is
initialized to `{@link null}` (falsey) so we can cheaply topo-sort the fields of a class.

items.name: self
stripRe
items.text:
A regular expression for stripping non-numeric characters from a numeric value.
This should be overridden for localization.

items.name: addConfig
items.text:
Adds new config properties to this class. This is called for classes when they
are declared, then for any mixins that class may define and finally for any
overrides defined that target the class.

items.name: mixinClass
items.text: The mixin class if the configs are from a mixin.

items.name: addMembers
members
items.text: The members to add to this class.

items.name: isStatic
items.text: Pass `true` if the members are static.

items.name: privacy
items.text:
Pass `true` if the members are private. This
only has meaning in debug mode and only for methods.

items.name: addStatics

items.text: this

items.name: borrow
fromClass
items.text: The class to borrow members from

items.name: members
items.text: The names of the members to borrow
this

items.name: create

items.text: the created instance.

items.name: createAlias
alias
items.text:
The new method name, or an object to set multiple aliases. See
{@link Ext.Function#method!flexSetter Ext.Function#flexSetter}

items.name: origin
items.text: The original method name

items.name: getConfigurator
items.text: Returns the `{@link Ext.Configurator}` for this class.

items.name: getName

items.text: className

items.name: mixin
items.text: Used internally by the mixins pre-processor

items.name: override
members
items.text:
The properties to add to this class. This should be
specified as an object literal containing one or more properties.
this class
